title: Uber launches healthcare platform
description: The dashboard, Uber Health, allows a healthcare worker to book a ride on demand or schedule a future ride for a patient.

title: Patient safety issues could drive $383B in healthcare costs by 2022
description: By 2022, avoidable adverse patient safety events across the U.S. and Western Europe, including healthcare-associated infections, sepsis and diagnostic errors, could cost $383.7 billion.

title: Denial Management: 8 Tips on How to Prevent Denied Claims
description: Get the top 8 denial management and prevention tips for your health care organization to eliminate payor denials before the claim is sent.

title: Front End Revenue Cycle: 5 Tips for Preventing and Managing Denials
description: Trouble with patient financial clearance on your hospital's front end can be the cause of denied claims in the back end of your revenue cycle. Read this blog from nThrive on front end revenue cycle management and denial prevention to learn more.

title: What is a Clinically Integrated Network?
description: Learn everything you need to know about a Clinically Integrated Network - definition, characteristics and more - in this webinar recap and replay from nThrive.

title: Alphabet studies how deep learning could predict heart disease risk
description: Researchers at Google parent Alphabets research arm used an algorithm to speed assessments of patient cardiovascular risk factors using eye scans.

title: Many hospitals lack strategy for leveraging smartphone technology
description: Apple leads as the smartphone of choice among healthcare organizations, but its weaknesses could cause other devices to become a new fan favorite, a KLAS Research report concludes.

title: Pay-for-Performance Strategies for Independent Physicians and Small Practices
description: Independent physicians and small practices can engage with pay-for-performance and value-based care using payer support and partnerships with peers.

title: Key Strategies for Succeeding with Healthcare Bundled Payments
description: Leveraging predictive analytics, improving patient engagement, and partnering with post-acute care providers are top healthcare bundled payments strategies.

title: Learn how hospitals are measuring, addressing social determinants of health
description: More hospitals are screening patients on health-related social needs as the industry has recognized the importance of factors outside the healthcare system on outcomes.

title: nThrive Welcomes New Leaders to Growing Organization
description: nThrive is pleased to announce the newest additions to its leadership. Bringing these members on to the team is another important step nThrive is taking toward delivering its vision to empower health care for every one in every community.

title: Join us at ACHE Central PA!
description: Kevin Smith, VP Product Management at nThrive, to speak on "Patient-Centered Care: What It Means And How To Get There." Don't miss out!

title: Join us at 340B Coalition Winter Conference!
description: Cecilia Williams, Sr. Manager, Govern Programs at nThrive, to discuss Medicare 340B Drug Changes effective January 1, 2018. Don't miss out!

title: nThrive Middle Revenue Cycle Solutions
description: nThrive's middle revenue cycle solutions help health care providers improve accuracy and efficiency in everything from charge capture to medical coding.

description: Is your health care organization feeling the margin squeeze? Download our Patient Access eBook and learn five ways to take your Patient Access operation to the next level.

title: CMS Actuaries: Economic, Demographic Factors Driving Healthcare Spending Growth
description: New estimates released Wednesday from CMSs Office of the Actuary project an average annual rate of national health spending growth of 5.5 percent for 20172026, outpacing average projected growth in GDP by 1.0 percentage point.

title: AHA recommends CMS delay application deadline for BPCI Advanced
description: AHA recommends CMS delay application deadline for BPCI Advanced The American Hospital Association is urging CMS to provide additional information and delay implementation of a new voluntary bundled payment model.

title: How Does HIPAA Compliance Apply in the Healthcare Cloud?
description: There are numerous benefits to utilizing the healthcare cloud, but entities need to make sure they maintain HIPAA compliance through the entire process.

title: Lack of interoperability a major barrier to value-based care transformation, hospital finance executives say
description: Value-based care contracts have doubled since 2015, and most respondents in a new HFMA survey said they see the benefits of the payment model. But lack of systems interoperability remains a major barrier to success, hospital finance leaders say.

title: Reduce Claim Denials by Looking to the Mid Revenue Cycle
description: If you want to reduce the number of denied claims from payors, look to the middle of your revenue cycle process for improvement opportunities. Read seven tips on how organizations can prevent denials in the first place.

title: RCM tip of the day: Take a multidisciplinary approach to claim denials
description: Hospitals and health systems continually seek to reduce claim denials so they don't miss out on revenue. One way to achieve this is by using a multidisciplinary approach, according to Kyle Kobe, vice president of consulting and analytic services at nThrive.

title: Cancer Registry Services and Oncology Data Management
description: nThrive cancer registry services and oncology data management can help compile and safeguard cancer patient data, potentially helping to improve their lives.

title: As Imaging Analytics Grows, Healthcare Orgs Should Proceed Cautiously
description: To improve care and cut costs, healthcare providers should thoughtfully consider which imaging analytics tools and strategies to implement.

title: 5 reasons why your EHR isn't enough for success in value-based care
description: Keeping in mind that the core mandate of value-based care is shifting accountability to providers for the holistic quality and cost of the care they deliver, five shortcomings of legacy EHRs become apparent.

title: 24% of physicians can't identify phishing emails: 5 things to know
description: Here are 5 things to know about why physicians have a difficult time identifying phishing emails.

title: Management organizations can play key role in ACOs
description: A Health Affairs report found partnerships helped providers in ACOs with data, administrative, educational and care coordination services.

title: The Strategic Value of Value
description: Dr. Carl Couch,  MD, MMM, chief medical officer at nThrive, discusses the strategic value of value and how even fee-for-service healthcare organizations can profit from adopting value-based strategies.

title: nThrive Named Category Leader in 2018 KLAS Report
description: nThrive was named Category Leader for Transcription Services in the 2018 Best in KLAS: Software & Services report.

title: Solve labor supply challenges by growing your own workforce
description: Tom Ormondroyd, President of Education and Analytics at nThrive, discusses how we often look to hospitals electronic health records (EHRs), technology and other systems as the culprits of the financial and operational challenges. What we fail to see is that a human, who is the end user of these systems, is at the core of every challenge. Learn more here.

title: Medical supply distribution poised for e-commerce migration
description: Cost-conscious providers will shift more distribution models to e-commerce platforms.

title: Breast cancer tool improves patient knowledge of treatment options
description: Interactive decision aid walks users systemically through key facts about surgery and chemotherapy.

title: Why healthcare interoperability moves at a snails pace
description: Vendors need to move beyond theoretical demonstrations of data exchange so that providers can have it work in practice.

title: Five healthcare technologies likely to be developed in the next 10 years
description: In the next decade, many of the concepts aiming to streamline the healthcare industry could be reality.

title: CMS requires hospitals use online portal to attest to EHR incentive programs
description: CMS requires hospitals use online portal to attest to EHR incentive programs CMS mandated Medicare-eligible hospitals. Learn more here!

title: 5 studies find millennials are sluggish when it comes to medical bills
description: Millennials sluggish with medical bills: 5 study findings Millennials tend to pay medical expenses at a slower rate than baby boomers or Generation X consumers.

title: Denials Prevention: An Ounce is Worth a Pound of Revenue
description: Identifying the root cause of denials is the surest way to prevent them. Read how providers can take a proactive approach across the front, middle and back to increase revenue.

title: RCM tip of the day: Pay attention to charge-based reimbursement
description: As hospitals move toward value-based care reimbursement models, charges should still be an area of focus, according to Glen Reiner, RN, principal director of revenue capture and charge audit services at nThrive. Mr. Reiner shared the following tip with Becker's Hospital Review.

title: RCM tip of the day: Provide patients with accurate charges
description: Hospitals seeking to reduce claim denials should focus on patient satisfaction, according to Sarah Bird, vice president of service solutions at nThrive. Continue reading here!

title: How to find the data you need for value-based care reporting
description: The growing emphasis on value-based care means doctors need detailed patient data for reporting purposes. Learn more in this next article.

title: Apple adds medical records to its Health app
description: Apple adds medical records to its Health app. Apple plans to integrate patient health records into its Health app in an attempt to make it easier for consumers to review their medical data.

title: Clinicians, MedPAC Criticize the Quality Payment Program, MIPS
description: A survey showed that 61 percent of clinicians do not view Quality Payment Program measures as important, while MedPAC recently voted to repeal MIPS.

title: Brain scanning method improves outcomes for emergency stroke patients
description: Study finds automated software helps identify salvageable tissue up to 16 hours after onset of symptoms.

description: The Certified Tumor Registrar workforce shortage is leaving many health organizations with unfilled positions and backlogs in their cancer surveillance reporting. Learn how outsourcing can help.

description: Lisa Marks, RHIT, CCS, director of client audits at nThrive, provides best practices in coding audits in this next article.

title: Marylands value-based care program controlled costs but didnt necessarily improve care
description: A new study finds mixed results for an innovative program in Maryland to cut healthcare spending while improving outcomes.

description: CIOX Health's legal action against HHS seeks clarity on how much providers can charge for copies of patient records.

description: Because the BCPI Advanced program qualifies as an advanced APM, participants could have access to MACRAs potential risks and added rewards.

title: Global Budget Payments Help to Treat Vulnerable Communities
description: The AHA called on CMS and Congress to consider global budget payment models to offer flexibility to providers treating patients in vulnerable communities.

title: CMS launches new voluntary bundled payment model
description: BPCI Advanced is aimed at aligning payment and care incentives, putting new pressure on providers to implement IT that supports value-based care.

title: Lessons learned from program to improve healthcare information exchange
description: One major piece of interoperability in healthcare is the expanded use of interstate, cross-state, and regional admission, discharge, and transfer (ADT) notifications across provider networks.

title: Physicians prefer using cell phones to communicate with patients
description: Communication between patient and physician is the foundation in building a close relationshipand cell phones have become the favored tool in clinical communication.

description: 6 insights into CMS' new voluntary inpatient and outpatient bundled payment model.

title: Cancer Immunotherapy Is Taken To The Next Level Using Viruses
description: A new study suggests that a combinations of two immunotherapies -- oncolytic viruses and checkpoint inhibitors -- could be much more successful than traditional treatments in fighting breast cancer and possibly other cancers.

title: Health Care Industry Must be Mindful of Information Blocking
description: Among other requirements, information blocking is prohibited as a condition to Electronic Health Record (EHR) certification, which is a requirement that EHRs must meet to qualify for use in Medicare/Medicaid EHR Incentive Programs.

title: CMS OK's texting for physicians, with stipulations
description: CMS reaffirmed and clarified its stance on physician texting in a Dec. 28 letter to state survey agency directors. Learn more here!

title: Health systems brace for 2018 disruption
description: Look for more care in outpatient settings as hospitals consider cost containment and hiring strategies to stay above water.

title: Learn why data sharing is critical to success under value-based care
description: For providers to improve performance and succeed, payers will need to share relevant claims data and integrate social determinants of care into the equation.

title: Healthcare mobile and IoT devices are becoming the norm
description: Organizations need to use their healthcare mobile and IoT devices to their fullest capacity by securing their data and considering real-time analytics.

title: CMS' updated star ratings formula still dings safety-net providers
description: The CMS has updated the star ratings on its Hospital Compare site using a new methodology that will give more hospitals one to five stars.

title: Few consumers have used telehealth to access care
description: Despite rising investment in the technology, only 18 percent of respondents to one survey have used it.

title: MACRA: Quality Payment Program Year 2, whats next?
description: nThrive has been selected, once again, as Qualified MIPS Registry by CMS!

title: Join Shriners Hospitals for Children This Holiday Season!
description: Shriners Hospitals for Children provides specialized care to children with orthopaedic conditions, burns, spinal cord injuries, and cleft lip and palate, regardless of the families ability to pay. Generally, care is provided until age 18, although, in some cases it may be extended to age 21. All care and services are provided in a family-centered environment.

title: Deliver the Christmas spirit to military families
description: Trees for Troops, a program of the Christmas SPIRIT Foundation, provides free, farm-grown Christmas Trees to United States armed forces members in all branches of the military and their families, through donations, sponsorships, grants and the work of many volunteers.

title: Join Toys for Tots this holiday season!
description: You can contribute to your local Toys for Tots campaign in several ways. You can donate a toy at one of the area toy drop locations, host a Toys for Tots event at your home, office or other venue and collect toys for Toys for Tots, or volunteer at the local warehouse.

title: Population Health Question and Answer Session
description: Learn about population health in this Q&A and hear from nThrive experts who spoke at a Beckers CEO + CFO Roundtable session in November.

title: Survey shows providers are warming to risk-based payments
description: AMGA released the results of a survey of member medical groups and health systems that found that they expect nearly 60% of revenues from Medicare will be risk-based by 2019.

title: 60% of medical practices' Medicare revenue expected to be risk-based by 2019
description: AMGA members expect the majority of their Medicare revenue will be risk-based in 2019.

title: Providers only have to do one thing now to avoid MACRA penalties in 2019
description: The American Medical Association is urging providers big and small to avoid a Medicare payment penalty in 2019 by taking the necessary steps now before December 31st.

description: ASPC was recently approved by CMS to function as a qualified clinical data registry.

description: If you are looking to lend a hand this holiday season, check out the salvation army and how you can help families this holiday.

description: What do we mean when we talk about healthcare "value"? It depends upon who's talking. Learn more here!

title: Hospitals will face greater cost containment efforts in 2018
description: Providers will try to rein in costs next year with a renewed focus on labor, purchase services and supply chain.

title: Growth and Scalability on The Road to Account-Based Marketing
description: Learn how nThrive's digital marketing team used Pardot, Salesforce's B2B Marketing Automation Platform, to consolidate their marketing tech stack and streamline their processes during a company-wide rebrand in this recap. Take a deep dive into how they set up their lead generation and lead nurturing programs in Pardot, and learn how they're shaping their account-based marketing strategy to deliver deeper personalization to their customers.

title: MACRA: Quality Payment Program Year 2, whats next?
description: At nThrives recent webinar, expert Moshe Starkman, nThrive senior VBR consultant, shared MACRAs Quality Payment Program Year 2 requirements, while contrasting the transition changes.

title: Fundamentals of CDM
description: Rebecca Marsh, Principal Business Health, CPC at nThrive, to speak at AAHIM Symposium-Birmingham, AL discussing the fundamentals of CDM at 3:00 PM. Don't miss out!

title: 2017 Hurricanes, Wildfires Prompt Changes in MIPS Reporting
description: CMS has announced it will ease the Merit-based Incentive Payment System reporting burden on family physicians affected by certain hurricanes and wildfires in 2017.

title: ACO savings arent driven by better care coordination of high-risk patients
description: The goal of accountable care organizations (ACOs), according to CMS, is to better coordinate care for chronically ill patients, avoiding unnecessary services and preventing errors.

title: New Version of Bundled Payments Will Have Broader Appeal
description: CMS may appear to be slowing the path to value-based care by ditching some bundled payment models, but a new program could revitalize the effort.

title: Three ways ONC can improve healthcare interoperability
description: Finding solutions to healthcare's interoperability problems continues to be a challenge considering the multiple stakeholders involved in the information highway.

title: Understanding HIPAA Data Sharing Policies for Better Patient Care
description: HIPAA data sharing can aid community health challenges. Learn more here!

title: Health Data Privacy Concerns Key Influence in PHI Data Sharing
description: A recent study found that PHI sharing can potentially be hindered because of patients having health data privacy concerns.

title: 6 things to know about larger systems with higher performance on value-based pay
description: Large medical practices with a higher-grade of meaningful use of health IT were more engaged in reporting quality data and ultimately performed at a higher level on quality and cost measures in the first year of Medicare's Value-Based Payment Modifier program, according to a new study.

title: Transforming bundled payments into episodes of care can give hospitals an edge
description: Hospitals are living in two worlds today: Planning for next-generation value-based care while praying that patient volumes increase under fee-for-service.

title: AHA report offers advice about value-based payment programs
description: The AHA said a key to a hospital or health system's value-based payment program success involves an organization's "capabilities and culture" as well as market and policy forces.
